3612 #endif
3613 
3614 /*
3615  * Find the next break boundary after startIndex. If the UStringSearch object
3616  * has an external break iterator, use that. Otherwise use the internal character
3617  * break iterator.
3618  */
3619 static int32_t nextBoundaryAfter(UStringSearch *strsrch, int32_t startIndex) {
3620 #if 0
3621     const UChar *text = strsrch->search->text;
3622     int32_t textLen   = strsrch->search->textLength;
3623 
3624     U_ASSERT(startIndex>=0);
3625     U_ASSERT(startIndex<=textLen);
3626 
3627     if (startIndex >= textLen) {
3628         return startIndex;
3629     }
3630 
3631     UChar32  c;
3632     int32_t  i = startIndex;
3633     U16_NEXT(text, i, textLen, c);
3634 
3635     // If we are on a control character, stop without looking for combining marks.
3636     //    Control characters do not combine.
3637     int32_t gcProperty = u_getIntPropertyValue(c, UCHAR_GRAPHEME_CLUSTER_BREAK);
3638     if (gcProperty==U_GCB_CONTROL || gcProperty==U_GCB_LF || gcProperty==U_GCB_CR) {
3639         return i;
3640     }
3641 
3642     // The initial character was not a control, and can thus accept trailing
3643     //   combining characters.  Advance over however many of them there are.
3644     int32_t  indexOfLastCharChecked;
3645     for (;;) {
3646         indexOfLastCharChecked = i;
3647         if (i>=textLen) {
3648             break;
3649         }
3650         U16_NEXT(text, i, textLen, c);
3651         gcProperty = u_getIntPropertyValue(c, UCHAR_GRAPHEME_CLUSTER_BREAK);
3652         if (gcProperty != U_GCB_EXTEND && gcProperty != U_GCB_SPACING_MARK) {
3653             break;
3654         }
3655     }
3656     return indexOfLastCharChecked;
3657 #elif !UCONFIG_NO_BREAK_ITERATION
3658     UBreakIterator *breakiterator = strsrch->search->breakIter;
3659 
3660     if (breakiterator == NULL) {
3661         breakiterator = strsrch->search->internalBreakIter;
3662     }
3663 
3664     if (breakiterator != NULL) {
3665         return ubrk_following(breakiterator, startIndex);
3666     }
3667 
3668     return startIndex;
3669 #else
3670     // **** or should we use the original code? ****
3671     return startIndex;
3672 #endif
3673 
3674 }
3675 
3676 /*
3677  * Returns TRUE if index is on a break boundary. If the UStringSearch
3678  * has an external break iterator, test using that, otherwise test
3679  * using the internal character break iterator.
3680  */
3681 static UBool isBreakBoundary(UStringSearch *strsrch, int32_t index) {
3682 #if 0
3683     const UChar *text = strsrch->search->text;
3684     int32_t textLen   = strsrch->search->textLength;
3685 
3686     U_ASSERT(index>=0);
3687     U_ASSERT(index<=textLen);
3688 
3689     if (index>=textLen || index<=0) {
3690         return TRUE;
3691     }
3692 
3693     // If the character at the current index is not a GRAPHEME_EXTEND
3694     //    then we can not be within a combining sequence.
3695     UChar32  c;
3696     U16_GET(text, 0, index, textLen, c);
3697     int32_t gcProperty = u_getIntPropertyValue(c, UCHAR_GRAPHEME_CLUSTER_BREAK);
3698     if (gcProperty != U_GCB_EXTEND && gcProperty != U_GCB_SPACING_MARK) {
3699         return TRUE;
3700     }
3701 
3702     // We are at a combining mark.  If the preceding character is anything
3703     //   except a CONTROL, CR or LF, we are in a combining sequence.
3704     U16_PREV(text, 0, index, c);
3705     gcProperty = u_getIntPropertyValue(c, UCHAR_GRAPHEME_CLUSTER_BREAK);
3706     UBool combining =  !(gcProperty==U_GCB_CONTROL || gcProperty==U_GCB_LF || gcProperty==U_GCB_CR);
3707     return !combining;
3708 #elif !UCONFIG_NO_BREAK_ITERATION
3709     UBreakIterator *breakiterator = strsrch->search->breakIter;
3710 
3711     if (breakiterator == NULL) {
3712         breakiterator = strsrch->search->internalBreakIter;
3713     }
3714 
3715     return (breakiterator != NULL && ubrk_isBoundary(breakiterator, index));
3716 #else
3717     // **** or use the original code? ****
3718     return TRUE;
3719 #endif
3720 }
3721 
3722 #if 0
3723 static UBool onBreakBoundaries(const UStringSearch *strsrch, int32_t start, int32_t end)
3724 {
3725 #if !UCONFIG_NO_BREAK_ITERATION
3726     UBreakIterator *breakiterator = strsrch->search->breakIter;
3727 
3728     if (breakiterator != NULL) {
3729         int32_t startindex = ubrk_first(breakiterator);
3730         int32_t endindex   = ubrk_last(breakiterator);
3731 
3732         // out-of-range indexes are never boundary positions
3733         if (start < startindex || start > endindex ||
3734             end < startindex || end > endindex) {
3735             return FALSE;
3736         }
3737 
3738         return ubrk_isBoundary(breakiterator, start) &&
3739                ubrk_isBoundary(breakiterator, end);
3740     }
3741 #endif
3742 
3743     return TRUE;
3744 }
3745 #endif
3746 
3747 typedef enum {
3748     U_CE_MATCH = -1,
3749     U_CE_NO_MATCH = 0,
3750     U_CE_SKIP_TARG,
3751     U_CE_SKIP_PATN
3752 } UCompareCEsResult;
3753 #define U_CE_LEVEL2_BASE 0x00000005
3754 #define U_CE_LEVEL3_BASE 0x00050000
3755 
3756 static UCompareCEsResult compareCE64s(int64_t targCE, int64_t patCE, int16_t compareType) {
3757     if (targCE == patCE) {
3758         return U_CE_MATCH;
3759     }
3760     if (compareType == 0) {
3761         return U_CE_NO_MATCH;
3762     }
3763 
3764     int64_t targCEshifted = targCE >> 32;
3765     int64_t patCEshifted = patCE >> 32;
3766     int64_t mask;
3767 
3768     mask = 0xFFFF0000;
3769     int32_t targLev1 = (int32_t)(targCEshifted & mask);
3770     int32_t patLev1 = (int32_t)(patCEshifted & mask);
3771     if ( targLev1 != patLev1 ) {
3772         if ( targLev1 == 0 ) {
3773             return U_CE_SKIP_TARG;
3774         }
3775         if ( patLev1 == 0 && compareType == USEARCH_ANY_BASE_WEIGHT_IS_WILDCARD ) {
3776             return U_CE_SKIP_PATN;
3777         }
3778         return U_CE_NO_MATCH;
3779     }
3780 
3781     mask = 0x0000FFFF;
3782     int32_t targLev2 = (int32_t)(targCEshifted & mask);
3783     int32_t patLev2 = (int32_t)(patCEshifted & mask);
3784     if ( targLev2 != patLev2 ) {
3785         if ( targLev2 == 0 ) {
3786             return U_CE_SKIP_TARG;
3787         }
3788         if ( patLev2 == 0 && compareType == USEARCH_ANY_BASE_WEIGHT_IS_WILDCARD ) {
3789             return U_CE_SKIP_PATN;
3790         }
3791         return (patLev2 == U_CE_LEVEL2_BASE || (compareType == USEARCH_ANY_BASE_WEIGHT_IS_WILDCARD && targLev2 == U_CE_LEVEL2_BASE) )?
3792             U_CE_MATCH: U_CE_NO_MATCH;
3793     }
3794 
3795     mask = 0xFFFF0000;
3796     int32_t targLev3 = (int32_t)(targCE & mask);
3797     int32_t patLev3 = (int32_t)(patCE & mask);
3798     if ( targLev3 != patLev3 ) {
3799         return (patLev3 == U_CE_LEVEL3_BASE || (compareType == USEARCH_ANY_BASE_WEIGHT_IS_WILDCARD && targLev3 == U_CE_LEVEL3_BASE) )?
3800             U_CE_MATCH: U_CE_NO_MATCH;
3801    }
3802 
3803     return U_CE_MATCH;
3804 }
3805 
3806 #if BOYER_MOORE
3807 // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, need 32-bit version of compareCE64s
3808 #endif
3809 
3810 namespace {
3811 
3812 UChar32 codePointAt(const USearch &search, int32_t index) {
3813     if (index < search.textLength) {
3814         UChar32 c;
3815         U16_NEXT(search.text, index, search.textLength, c);
3816         return c;
3817     }
3818     return U_SENTINEL;
3819 }
3820 
3821 UChar32 codePointBefore(const USearch &search, int32_t index) {
3822     if (0 < index) {
3823         UChar32 c;
3824         U16_PREV(search.text, 0, index, c);
3825         return c;
3826     }
3827     return U_SENTINEL;
3828 }
3829 
3830 }  // namespace
3831 
3832 U_CAPI UBool U_EXPORT2 usearch_search(UStringSearch  *strsrch,
3833                                        int32_t        startIdx,
3834                                        int32_t        *matchStart,
3835                                        int32_t        *matchLimit,
3836                                        UErrorCode     *status)
3837 {
3838     if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
3839         return FALSE;
3840     }
3841 
3842     // TODO:  reject search patterns beginning with a combining char.
3843 
3844 #ifdef USEARCH_DEBUG
3845     if (getenv("USEARCH_DEBUG") != NULL) {
3846         printf("Pattern CEs\n");
3847         for (int ii=0; ii<strsrch->pattern.cesLength; ii++) {
3848             printf(" %8x", strsrch->pattern.ces[ii]);
3849         }
3850         printf("\n");
3851     }
3852 
3853 #endif
3854     // Input parameter sanity check.
3855     //  TODO:  should input indicies clip to the text length
3856     //         in the same way that UText does.
3857     if(strsrch->pattern.cesLength == 0         ||
3858        startIdx < 0                           ||
3859        startIdx > strsrch->search->textLength ||
3860        strsrch->pattern.ces == NULL) {
3861            *status = U_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT_ERROR;
3862            return FALSE;
3863     }
3864 
3865     if (strsrch->pattern.pces == NULL) {
3866         initializePatternPCETable(strsrch, status);
3867     }
3868 
3869     ucol_setOffset(strsrch->textIter, startIdx, status);
3870     CEIBuffer ceb(strsrch, status);
3871 
3872 
3873     int32_t    targetIx = 0;
3874     const CEI *targetCEI = NULL;
3875     int32_t    patIx;
3876     UBool      found;
3877 
3878     int32_t  mStart = -1;
3879     int32_t  mLimit = -1;
3880     int32_t  minLimit;
3881     int32_t  maxLimit;
3882 
3883 
3884 
3885     // Outer loop moves over match starting positions in the
3886     //      target CE space.
3887     // Here we see the target as a sequence of collation elements, resulting from the following:
3888     // 1. Target characters were decomposed, and (if appropriate) other compressions and expansions are applied
3889     //    (for example, digraphs such as IJ may be broken into two characters).
3890     // 2. An int64_t CE weight is determined for each resulting unit (high 16 bits are primary strength, next
3891     //    16 bits are secondary, next 16 (the high 16 bits of the low 32-bit half) are tertiary. Any of these
3892     //    fields that are for strengths below that of the collator are set to 0. If this makes the int64_t
3893     //    CE weight 0 (as for a combining diacritic with secondary weight when the collator strentgh is primary),
3894     //    then the CE is deleted, so the following code sees only CEs that are relevant.
3895     // For each CE, the lowIndex and highIndex correspond to where this CE begins and ends in the original text.
3896     // If lowIndex==highIndex, either the CE resulted from an expansion/decomposition of one of the original text
3897     // characters, or the CE marks the limit of the target text (in which case the CE weight is UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER).
3898     //
3899     for(targetIx=0; ; targetIx++)
3900     {
3901         found = TRUE;
3902         //  Inner loop checks for a match beginning at each
3903         //  position from the outer loop.
3904         int32_t targetIxOffset = 0;
3905         int64_t patCE = 0;
3906         // For targetIx > 0, this ceb.get gets a CE that is as far back in the ring buffer
3907         // (compared to the last CE fetched for the previous targetIx value) as we need to go
3908         // for this targetIx value, so if it is non-NULL then other ceb.get calls should be OK.
3909         const CEI *firstCEI = ceb.get(targetIx);
3910         if (firstCEI == NULL) {
3911             *status = U_INTERNAL_PROGRAM_ERROR;
3912             found = FALSE;
3913             break;
3914         }
3915 
3916         for (patIx=0; patIx<strsrch->pattern.pcesLength; patIx++) {
3917             patCE = strsrch->pattern.pces[patIx];
3918             targetCEI = ceb.get(targetIx+patIx+targetIxOffset);
3919             //  Compare CE from target string with CE from the pattern.
3920             //    Note that the target CE will be UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER if we reach the end of input,
3921             //    which will fail the compare, below.
3922             UCompareCEsResult ceMatch = compareCE64s(targetCEI->ce, patCE, strsrch->search->elementComparisonType);
3923             if ( ceMatch == U_CE_NO_MATCH ) {
3924                 found = FALSE;
3925                 break;
3926             } else if ( ceMatch > U_CE_NO_MATCH ) {
3927                 if ( ceMatch == U_CE_SKIP_TARG ) {
3928                     // redo with same patCE, next targCE
3929                     patIx--;
3930                     targetIxOffset++;
3931                 } else { // ceMatch == U_CE_SKIP_PATN
3932                     // redo with same targCE, next patCE
3933                     targetIxOffset--;
3934                 }
3935             }
3936         }
3937         targetIxOffset += strsrch->pattern.pcesLength; // this is now the offset in target CE space to end of the match so far
3938 
3939         if (!found && ((targetCEI == NULL) || (targetCEI->ce != UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER))) {
3940             // No match at this targetIx.  Try again at the next.
3941             continue;
3942         }
3943 
3944         if (!found) {
3945             // No match at all, we have run off the end of the target text.
3946             break;
3947         }
3948 
3949 
3950         // We have found a match in CE space.
3951         // Now determine the bounds in string index space.
3952         //  There still is a chance of match failure if the CE range not correspond to
3953         //     an acceptable character range.
3954         //
3955         const CEI *lastCEI  = ceb.get(targetIx + targetIxOffset - 1);
3956 
3957         mStart   = firstCEI->lowIndex;
3958         minLimit = lastCEI->lowIndex;
3959 
3960         // Look at the CE following the match.  If it is UCOL_NULLORDER the match
3961         //   extended to the end of input, and the match is good.
3962 
3963         // Look at the high and low indices of the CE following the match. If
3964         // they are the same it means one of two things:
3965         //    1. The match extended to the last CE from the target text, which is OK, or
3966         //    2. The last CE that was part of the match is in an expansion that extends
3967         //       to the first CE after the match. In this case, we reject the match.
3968         const CEI *nextCEI = 0;
3969         if (strsrch->search->elementComparisonType == 0) {
3970             nextCEI  = ceb.get(targetIx + targetIxOffset);
3971             maxLimit = nextCEI->lowIndex;
3972             if (nextCEI->lowIndex == nextCEI->highIndex && nextCEI->ce != UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER) {
3973                 found = FALSE;
3974             }
3975         } else {
3976             for ( ; ; ++targetIxOffset ) {
3977                 nextCEI = ceb.get(targetIx + targetIxOffset);
3978                 maxLimit = nextCEI->lowIndex;
3979                 // If we are at the end of the target too, match succeeds
3980                 if (  nextCEI->ce == UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER ) {
3981                     break;
3982                 }
3983                 // As long as the next CE has primary weight of 0,
3984                 // it is part of the last target element matched by the pattern;
3985                 // make sure it can be part of a match with the last patCE
3986                 if ( (((nextCEI->ce) >> 32) & 0xFFFF0000UL) == 0 ) {
3987                     UCompareCEsResult ceMatch = compareCE64s(nextCEI->ce, patCE, strsrch->search->elementComparisonType);
3988                     if ( ceMatch == U_CE_NO_MATCH || ceMatch == U_CE_SKIP_PATN ) {
3989                         found = FALSE;
3990                         break;
3991                     }
3992                 // If lowIndex == highIndex, this target CE is part of an expansion of the last matched
3993                 // target element, but it has non-zero primary weight => match fails
3994                 } else if ( nextCEI->lowIndex == nextCEI->highIndex ) {
3995                     found = false;
3996                     break;
3997                 // Else the target CE is not part of an expansion of the last matched element, match succeeds
3998                 } else {
3999                     break;
4000                 }
4001             }
4002         }
4003 
4004 
4005         // Check for the start of the match being within a combining sequence.
4006         //   This can happen if the pattern itself begins with a combining char, and
4007         //   the match found combining marks in the target text that were attached
4008         //    to something else.
4009         //   This type of match should be rejected for not completely consuming a
4010         //   combining sequence.
4011         if (!isBreakBoundary(strsrch, mStart)) {
4012             found = FALSE;
4013         }
4014 
4015         // Check for the start of the match being within an Collation Element Expansion,
4016         //   meaning that the first char of the match is only partially matched.
4017         //   With exapnsions, the first CE will report the index of the source
4018         //   character, and all subsequent (expansions) CEs will report the source index of the
4019         //    _following_ character.
4020         int32_t secondIx = firstCEI->highIndex;
4021         if (mStart == secondIx) {
4022             found = FALSE;
4023         }
4024 
4025         // Allow matches to end in the middle of a grapheme cluster if the following
4026         // conditions are met; this is needed to make prefix search work properly in
4027         // Indic, see #11750
4028         // * the default breakIter is being used
4029         // * the next collation element after this combining sequence
4030         //   - has non-zero primary weight
4031         //   - corresponds to a separate character following the one at end of the current match
4032         //   (the second of these conditions, and perhaps both, may be redundant given the
4033         //   subsequent check for normalization boundary; however they are likely much faster
4034         //   tests in any case)
4035         // * the match limit is a normalization boundary
4036         UBool allowMidclusterMatch = FALSE;
4037         if (strsrch->search->text != NULL && strsrch->search->textLength > maxLimit) {
4038             allowMidclusterMatch =
4039                     strsrch->search->breakIter == NULL &&
4040                     nextCEI != NULL && (((nextCEI->ce) >> 32) & 0xFFFF0000UL) != 0 &&
4041                     maxLimit >= lastCEI->highIndex && nextCEI->highIndex > maxLimit &&
4042                     (strsrch->nfd->hasBoundaryBefore(codePointAt(*strsrch->search, maxLimit)) ||
4043                         strsrch->nfd->hasBoundaryAfter(codePointBefore(*strsrch->search, maxLimit)));
4044         }
4045         // If those conditions are met, then:
4046         // * do NOT advance the candidate match limit (mLimit) to a break boundary; however
4047         //   the match limit may be backed off to a previous break boundary. This handles
4048         //   cases in which mLimit includes target characters that are ignorable with current
4049         //   settings (such as space) and which extend beyond the pattern match.
4050         // * do NOT require that end of the combining sequence not extend beyond the match in CE space
4051         // * do NOT require that match limit be on a breakIter boundary
4052 
4053         //  Advance the match end position to the first acceptable match boundary.
4054         //    This advances the index over any combining charcters.
4055         mLimit = maxLimit;
4056         if (minLimit < maxLimit) {
4057             // When the last CE's low index is same with its high index, the CE is likely
4058             // a part of expansion. In this case, the index is located just after the
4059             // character corresponding to the CEs compared above. If the index is right
4060             // at the break boundary, move the position to the next boundary will result
4061             // incorrect match length when there are ignorable characters exist between
4062             // the position and the next character produces CE(s). See ticket#8482.
4063             if (minLimit == lastCEI->highIndex && isBreakBoundary(strsrch, minLimit)) {
4064                 mLimit = minLimit;
4065             } else {
4066                 int32_t nba = nextBoundaryAfter(strsrch, minLimit);
4067                 // Note that we can have nba < maxLimit && nba >= minLImit, in which
4068                 // case we want to set mLimit to nba regardless of allowMidclusterMatch
4069                 // (i.e. we back off mLimit to the previous breakIterator boundary).
4070                 if (nba >= lastCEI->highIndex && (!allowMidclusterMatch || nba < maxLimit)) {
4071                     mLimit = nba;
4072                 }
4073             }
4074         }
4075 
4076     #ifdef USEARCH_DEBUG
4077         if (getenv("USEARCH_DEBUG") != NULL) {
4078             printf("minLimit, maxLimit, mLimit = %d, %d, %d\n", minLimit, maxLimit, mLimit);
4079         }
4080     #endif
4081 
4082         if (!allowMidclusterMatch) {
4083             // If advancing to the end of a combining sequence in character indexing space
4084             //   advanced us beyond the end of the match in CE space, reject this match.
4085             if (mLimit > maxLimit) {
4086                 found = FALSE;
4087             }
4088 
4089             if (!isBreakBoundary(strsrch, mLimit)) {
4090                 found = FALSE;
4091             }
4092         }
4093 
4094         if (! checkIdentical(strsrch, mStart, mLimit)) {
4095             found = FALSE;
4096         }
4097 
4098         if (found) {
4099             break;
4100         }
4101     }
4102 
4103     #ifdef USEARCH_DEBUG
4104     if (getenv("USEARCH_DEBUG") != NULL) {
4105         printf("Target CEs [%d .. %d]\n", ceb.firstIx, ceb.limitIx);
4106         int32_t  lastToPrint = ceb.limitIx+2;
4107         for (int ii=ceb.firstIx; ii<lastToPrint; ii++) {
4108             printf("%8x@%d ", ceb.get(ii)->ce, ceb.get(ii)->srcIndex);
4109         }
4110         printf("\n%s\n", found? "match found" : "no match");
4111     }
4112     #endif
4113 
4114     // All Done.  Store back the match bounds to the caller.
4115     //
4116     if (found==FALSE) {
4117         mLimit = -1;
4118         mStart = -1;
4119     }
4120 
4121     if (matchStart != NULL) {
4122         *matchStart= mStart;
4123     }
4124 
4125     if (matchLimit != NULL) {
4126         *matchLimit = mLimit;
4127     }
4128 
4129     return found;
4130 }
4131 
4132 U_CAPI UBool U_EXPORT2 usearch_searchBackwards(UStringSearch  *strsrch,
4133                                                 int32_t        startIdx,
4134                                                 int32_t        *matchStart,
4135                                                 int32_t        *matchLimit,
4136                                                 UErrorCode     *status)
4137 {
4138     if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4139         return FALSE;
4140     }
4141 
4142     // TODO:  reject search patterns beginning with a combining char.
4143 
4144 #ifdef USEARCH_DEBUG
4145     if (getenv("USEARCH_DEBUG") != NULL) {
4146         printf("Pattern CEs\n");
4147         for (int ii=0; ii<strsrch->pattern.cesLength; ii++) {
4148             printf(" %8x", strsrch->pattern.ces[ii]);
4149         }
4150         printf("\n");
4151     }
4152 
4153 #endif
4154     // Input parameter sanity check.
4155     //  TODO:  should input indicies clip to the text length
4156     //         in the same way that UText does.
4157     if(strsrch->pattern.cesLength == 0         ||
4158        startIdx < 0                           ||
4159        startIdx > strsrch->search->textLength ||
4160        strsrch->pattern.ces == NULL) {
4161            *status = U_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT_ERROR;
4162            return FALSE;
4163     }
4164 
4165     if (strsrch->pattern.pces == NULL) {
4166         initializePatternPCETable(strsrch, status);
4167     }
4168 
4169     CEIBuffer ceb(strsrch, status);
4170     int32_t    targetIx = 0;
4171 
4172     /*
4173      * Pre-load the buffer with the CE's for the grapheme
4174      * after our starting position so that we're sure that
4175      * we can look at the CE following the match when we
4176      * check the match boundaries.
4177      *
4178      * This will also pre-fetch the first CE that we'll
4179      * consider for the match.
4180      */
4181     if (startIdx < strsrch->search->textLength) {
4182         UBreakIterator *bi = strsrch->search->internalBreakIter;
4183         int32_t next = ubrk_following(bi, startIdx);
4184 
4185         ucol_setOffset(strsrch->textIter, next, status);
4186 
4187         for (targetIx = 0; ; targetIx += 1) {
4188             if (ceb.getPrevious(targetIx)->lowIndex < startIdx) {
4189                 break;
4190             }
4191         }
4192     } else {
4193         ucol_setOffset(strsrch->textIter, startIdx, status);
4194     }
4195 
4196 
4197     const CEI *targetCEI = NULL;
4198     int32_t    patIx;
4199     UBool      found;
4200 
4201     int32_t  limitIx = targetIx;
4202     int32_t  mStart = -1;
4203     int32_t  mLimit = -1;
4204     int32_t  minLimit;
4205     int32_t  maxLimit;
4206 
4207 
4208 
4209     // Outer loop moves over match starting positions in the
4210     //      target CE space.
4211     // Here, targetIx values increase toward the beginning of the base text (i.e. we get the text CEs in reverse order).
4212     // But  patIx is 0 at the beginning of the pattern and increases toward the end.
4213     // So this loop performs a comparison starting with the end of pattern, and prcessd toward the beginning of the pattern
4214     // and the beginning of the base text.
4215     for(targetIx = limitIx; ; targetIx += 1)
4216     {
4217         found = TRUE;
4218         // For targetIx > limitIx, this ceb.getPrevious gets a CE that is as far back in the ring buffer
4219         // (compared to the last CE fetched for the previous targetIx value) as we need to go
4220         // for this targetIx value, so if it is non-NULL then other ceb.getPrevious calls should be OK.
4221         const CEI *lastCEI  = ceb.getPrevious(targetIx);
4222         if (lastCEI == NULL) {
4223             *status = U_INTERNAL_PROGRAM_ERROR;
4224             found = FALSE;
4225              break;
4226         }
4227         //  Inner loop checks for a match beginning at each
4228         //  position from the outer loop.
4229         int32_t targetIxOffset = 0;
4230         for (patIx = strsrch->pattern.pcesLength - 1; patIx >= 0; patIx -= 1) {
4231             int64_t patCE = strsrch->pattern.pces[patIx];
4232 
4233             targetCEI = ceb.getPrevious(targetIx + strsrch->pattern.pcesLength - 1 - patIx + targetIxOffset);
4234             //  Compare CE from target string with CE from the pattern.
4235             //    Note that the target CE will be UCOL_NULLORDER if we reach the end of input,
4236             //    which will fail the compare, below.
4237             UCompareCEsResult ceMatch = compareCE64s(targetCEI->ce, patCE, strsrch->search->elementComparisonType);
4238             if ( ceMatch == U_CE_NO_MATCH ) {
4239                 found = FALSE;
4240                 break;
4241             } else if ( ceMatch > U_CE_NO_MATCH ) {
4242                 if ( ceMatch == U_CE_SKIP_TARG ) {
4243                     // redo with same patCE, next targCE
4244                     patIx++;
4245                     targetIxOffset++;
4246                 } else { // ceMatch == U_CE_SKIP_PATN
4247                     // redo with same targCE, next patCE
4248                     targetIxOffset--;
4249                 }
4250             }
4251         }
4252 
4253         if (!found && ((targetCEI == NULL) || (targetCEI->ce != UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER))) {
4254             // No match at this targetIx.  Try again at the next.
4255             continue;
4256         }
4257 
4258         if (!found) {
4259             // No match at all, we have run off the end of the target text.
4260             break;
4261         }
4262 
4263 
4264         // We have found a match in CE space.
4265         // Now determine the bounds in string index space.
4266         //  There still is a chance of match failure if the CE range not correspond to
4267         //     an acceptable character range.
4268         //
4269         const CEI *firstCEI = ceb.getPrevious(targetIx + strsrch->pattern.pcesLength - 1 + targetIxOffset);
4270         mStart   = firstCEI->lowIndex;
4271 
4272         // Check for the start of the match being within a combining sequence.
4273         //   This can happen if the pattern itself begins with a combining char, and
4274         //   the match found combining marks in the target text that were attached
4275         //    to something else.
4276         //   This type of match should be rejected for not completely consuming a
4277         //   combining sequence.
4278         if (!isBreakBoundary(strsrch, mStart)) {
4279             found = FALSE;
4280         }
4281 
4282         // Look at the high index of the first CE in the match. If it's the same as the
4283         // low index, the first CE in the match is in the middle of an expansion.
4284         if (mStart == firstCEI->highIndex) {
4285             found = FALSE;
4286         }
4287 
4288 
4289         minLimit = lastCEI->lowIndex;
4290 
4291         if (targetIx > 0) {
4292             // Look at the CE following the match.  If it is UCOL_NULLORDER the match
4293             //   extended to the end of input, and the match is good.
4294 
4295             // Look at the high and low indices of the CE following the match. If
4296             // they are the same it means one of two things:
4297             //    1. The match extended to the last CE from the target text, which is OK, or
4298             //    2. The last CE that was part of the match is in an expansion that extends
4299             //       to the first CE after the match. In this case, we reject the match.
4300             const CEI *nextCEI  = ceb.getPrevious(targetIx - 1);
4301 
4302             if (nextCEI->lowIndex == nextCEI->highIndex && nextCEI->ce != UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER) {
4303                 found = FALSE;
4304             }
4305 
4306             mLimit = maxLimit = nextCEI->lowIndex;
4307 
4308             // Allow matches to end in the middle of a grapheme cluster if the following
4309             // conditions are met; this is needed to make prefix search work properly in
4310             // Indic, see #11750
4311             // * the default breakIter is being used
4312             // * the next collation element after this combining sequence
4313             //   - has non-zero primary weight
4314             //   - corresponds to a separate character following the one at end of the current match
4315             //   (the second of these conditions, and perhaps both, may be redundant given the
4316             //   subsequent check for normalization boundary; however they are likely much faster
4317             //   tests in any case)
4318             // * the match limit is a normalization boundary
4319             UBool allowMidclusterMatch = FALSE;
4320             if (strsrch->search->text != NULL && strsrch->search->textLength > maxLimit) {
4321                 allowMidclusterMatch =
4322                         strsrch->search->breakIter == NULL &&
4323                         nextCEI != NULL && (((nextCEI->ce) >> 32) & 0xFFFF0000UL) != 0 &&
4324                         maxLimit >= lastCEI->highIndex && nextCEI->highIndex > maxLimit &&
4325                         (strsrch->nfd->hasBoundaryBefore(codePointAt(*strsrch->search, maxLimit)) ||
4326                             strsrch->nfd->hasBoundaryAfter(codePointBefore(*strsrch->search, maxLimit)));
4327             }
4328             // If those conditions are met, then:
4329             // * do NOT advance the candidate match limit (mLimit) to a break boundary; however
4330             //   the match limit may be backed off to a previous break boundary. This handles
4331             //   cases in which mLimit includes target characters that are ignorable with current
4332             //   settings (such as space) and which extend beyond the pattern match.
4333             // * do NOT require that end of the combining sequence not extend beyond the match in CE space
4334             // * do NOT require that match limit be on a breakIter boundary
4335 
4336             //  Advance the match end position to the first acceptable match boundary.
4337             //    This advances the index over any combining characters.
4338             if (minLimit < maxLimit) {
4339                 int32_t nba = nextBoundaryAfter(strsrch, minLimit);
4340                 // Note that we can have nba < maxLimit && nba >= minLImit, in which
4341                 // case we want to set mLimit to nba regardless of allowMidclusterMatch
4342                 // (i.e. we back off mLimit to the previous breakIterator boundary).
4343                 if (nba >= lastCEI->highIndex && (!allowMidclusterMatch || nba < maxLimit)) {
4344                     mLimit = nba;
4345                 }
4346             }
4347 
4348             if (!allowMidclusterMatch) {
4349                 // If advancing to the end of a combining sequence in character indexing space
4350                 //   advanced us beyond the end of the match in CE space, reject this match.
4351                 if (mLimit > maxLimit) {
4352                     found = FALSE;
4353                 }
4354 
4355                 // Make sure the end of the match is on a break boundary
4356                 if (!isBreakBoundary(strsrch, mLimit)) {
4357                     found = FALSE;
4358                 }
4359             }
4360 
4361         } else {
4362             // No non-ignorable CEs after this point.
4363             // The maximum position is detected by boundary after
4364             // the last non-ignorable CE. Combining sequence
4365             // across the start index will be truncated.
4366             int32_t nba = nextBoundaryAfter(strsrch, minLimit);
4367             mLimit = maxLimit = (nba > 0) && (startIdx > nba) ? nba : startIdx;
4368         }
4369 
4370     #ifdef USEARCH_DEBUG
4371         if (getenv("USEARCH_DEBUG") != NULL) {
4372             printf("minLimit, maxLimit, mLimit = %d, %d, %d\n", minLimit, maxLimit, mLimit);
4373         }
4374     #endif
4375 
4376 
4377         if (! checkIdentical(strsrch, mStart, mLimit)) {
4378             found = FALSE;
4379         }
4380 
4381         if (found) {
4382             break;
4383         }
4384     }
4385 
4386     #ifdef USEARCH_DEBUG
4387     if (getenv("USEARCH_DEBUG") != NULL) {
4388         printf("Target CEs [%d .. %d]\n", ceb.firstIx, ceb.limitIx);
4389         int32_t  lastToPrint = ceb.limitIx+2;
4390         for (int ii=ceb.firstIx; ii<lastToPrint; ii++) {
4391             printf("%8x@%d ", ceb.get(ii)->ce, ceb.get(ii)->srcIndex);
4392         }
4393         printf("\n%s\n", found? "match found" : "no match");
4394     }
4395     #endif
4396 
4397     // All Done.  Store back the match bounds to the caller.
4398     //
4399     if (found==FALSE) {
4400         mLimit = -1;
4401         mStart = -1;
4402     }
4403 
4404     if (matchStart != NULL) {
4405         *matchStart= mStart;
4406     }
4407 
4408     if (matchLimit != NULL) {
4409         *matchLimit = mLimit;
4410     }
4411 
4412     return found;
4413 }
4414 
4415 // internal use methods declared in usrchimp.h -----------------------------
4416 
4417 UBool usearch_handleNextExact(UStringSearch *strsrch, UErrorCode *status)
4418 {
4419     if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4420         setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4421         return FALSE;
4422     }
4423 
4424 #if BOYER_MOORE
4425     UCollationElements *coleiter        = strsrch->textIter;
4426     int32_t             textlength      = strsrch->search->textLength;
4427     int32_t            *patternce       = strsrch->pattern.ces;
4428     int32_t             patterncelength = strsrch->pattern.cesLength;
4429     int32_t             textoffset      = ucol_getOffset(coleiter);
4430 
4431     // status used in setting coleiter offset, since offset is checked in
4432     // shiftForward before setting the coleiter offset, status never
4433     // a failure
4434     textoffset = shiftForward(strsrch, textoffset, UCOL_NULLORDER,
4435                               patterncelength);
4436     while (textoffset <= textlength)
4437     {
4438         uint32_t    patternceindex = patterncelength - 1;
4439         int32_t     targetce;
4440         UBool       found          = FALSE;
4441         int32_t    lastce          = UCOL_NULLORDER;
4442 
4443         setColEIterOffset(coleiter, textoffset);
4444 
4445         for (;;) {
4446             // finding the last pattern ce match, imagine composite characters
4447             // for example: search for pattern A in text \u00C0
4448             // we'll have to skip \u0300 the grave first before we get to A
4449             targetce = ucol_previous(coleiter, status);
4450             if (U_FAILURE(*status) || targetce == UCOL_NULLORDER) {
4451                 found = FALSE;
4452                 break;
4453             }
4454             targetce = getCE(strsrch, targetce);
4455             if (targetce == UCOL_IGNORABLE && inNormBuf(coleiter)) {
4456                 // this is for the text \u0315\u0300 that requires
4457                 // normalization and pattern \u0300, where \u0315 is ignorable
4458                 continue;
4459             }
4460             if (lastce == UCOL_NULLORDER || lastce == UCOL_IGNORABLE) {
4461                 lastce = targetce;
4462             }
4463             // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, replace with code using 32-bit version of compareCE64s
4464             if (targetce == patternce[patternceindex]) {
4465                 // the first ce can be a contraction
4466                 found = TRUE;
4467                 break;
4468             }
4469             if (!hasExpansion(coleiter)) {
4470                 found = FALSE;
4471                 break;
4472             }
4473         }
4474 
4475         //targetce = lastce;
4476 
4477         while (found && patternceindex > 0) {
4478             lastce = targetce;
4479             targetce    = ucol_previous(coleiter, status);
4480             if (U_FAILURE(*status) || targetce == UCOL_NULLORDER) {
4481                 found = FALSE;
4482                 break;
4483             }
4484             targetce    = getCE(strsrch, targetce);
4485             if (targetce == UCOL_IGNORABLE) {
4486                 continue;
4487             }
4488 
4489             patternceindex --;
4490             // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, replace with code using 32-bit version of compareCE64s
4491             found = found && targetce == patternce[patternceindex];
4492         }
4493 
4494         targetce = lastce;
4495 
4496         if (!found) {
4497             if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4498                 break;
4499             }
4500             textoffset = shiftForward(strsrch, textoffset, lastce,
4501                                       patternceindex);
4502             // status checked at loop.
4503             patternceindex = patterncelength;
4504             continue;
4505         }
4506 
4507         if (checkNextExactMatch(strsrch, &textoffset, status)) {
4508             // status checked in ucol_setOffset
4509             setColEIterOffset(coleiter, strsrch->search->matchedIndex);
4510             return TRUE;
4511         }
4512     }
4513     setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4514     return FALSE;
4515 #else
4516     int32_t textOffset = ucol_getOffset(strsrch->textIter);
4517     int32_t start = -1;
4518     int32_t end = -1;
4519 
4520     if (usearch_search(strsrch, textOffset, &start, &end, status)) {
4521         strsrch->search->matchedIndex  = start;
4522         strsrch->search->matchedLength = end - start;
4523         return TRUE;
4524     } else {
4525         setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4526         return FALSE;
4527     }
4528 #endif
4529 }
4530 
4531 UBool usearch_handleNextCanonical(UStringSearch *strsrch, UErrorCode *status)
4532 {
4533     if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4534         setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4535         return FALSE;
4536     }
4537 
4538 #if BOYER_MOORE
4539     UCollationElements *coleiter        = strsrch->textIter;
4540     int32_t             textlength      = strsrch->search->textLength;
4541     int32_t            *patternce       = strsrch->pattern.ces;
4542     int32_t             patterncelength = strsrch->pattern.cesLength;
4543     int32_t             textoffset      = ucol_getOffset(coleiter);
4544     UBool               hasPatternAccents =
4545        strsrch->pattern.hasSuffixAccents || strsrch->pattern.hasPrefixAccents;
4546 
4547     textoffset = shiftForward(strsrch, textoffset, UCOL_NULLORDER,
4548                               patterncelength);
4549     strsrch->canonicalPrefixAccents[0] = 0;
4550     strsrch->canonicalSuffixAccents[0] = 0;
4551 
4552     while (textoffset <= textlength)
4553     {
4554         int32_t     patternceindex = patterncelength - 1;
4555         int32_t     targetce;
4556         UBool       found          = FALSE;
4557         int32_t     lastce         = UCOL_NULLORDER;
4558 
4559         setColEIterOffset(coleiter, textoffset);
4560 
4561         for (;;) {
4562             // finding the last pattern ce match, imagine composite characters
4563             // for example: search for pattern A in text \u00C0
4564             // we'll have to skip \u0300 the grave first before we get to A
4565             targetce = ucol_previous(coleiter, status);
4566             if (U_FAILURE(*status) || targetce == UCOL_NULLORDER) {
4567                 found = FALSE;
4568                 break;
4569             }
4570             targetce = getCE(strsrch, targetce);
4571             if (lastce == UCOL_NULLORDER || lastce == UCOL_IGNORABLE) {
4572                 lastce = targetce;
4573             }
4574             // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, replace with code using 32-bit version of compareCE64s
4575             if (targetce == patternce[patternceindex]) {
4576                 // the first ce can be a contraction
4577                 found = TRUE;
4578                 break;
4579             }
4580             if (!hasExpansion(coleiter)) {
4581                 found = FALSE;
4582                 break;
4583             }
4584         }
4585 
4586         while (found && patternceindex > 0) {
4587             targetce    = ucol_previous(coleiter, status);
4588             if (U_FAILURE(*status) || targetce == UCOL_NULLORDER) {
4589                 found = FALSE;
4590                 break;
4591             }
4592             targetce    = getCE(strsrch, targetce);
4593             if (targetce == UCOL_IGNORABLE) {
4594                 continue;
4595             }
4596 
4597             patternceindex --;
4598             // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, replace with code using 32-bit version of compareCE64s
4599             found = found && targetce == patternce[patternceindex];
4600         }
4601 
4602         // initializing the rearranged accent array
4603         if (hasPatternAccents && !found) {
4604             strsrch->canonicalPrefixAccents[0] = 0;
4605             strsrch->canonicalSuffixAccents[0] = 0;
4606             if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4607                 break;
4608             }
4609             found = doNextCanonicalMatch(strsrch, textoffset, status);
4610         }
4611 
4612         if (!found) {
4613             if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4614                 break;
4615             }
4616             textoffset = shiftForward(strsrch, textoffset, lastce,
4617                                       patternceindex);
4618             // status checked at loop
4619             patternceindex = patterncelength;
4620             continue;
4621         }
4622 
4623         if (checkNextCanonicalMatch(strsrch, &textoffset, status)) {
4624             setColEIterOffset(coleiter, strsrch->search->matchedIndex);
4625             return TRUE;
4626         }
4627     }
4628     setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4629     return FALSE;
4630 #else
4631     int32_t textOffset = ucol_getOffset(strsrch->textIter);
4632     int32_t start = -1;
4633     int32_t end = -1;
4634 
4635     if (usearch_search(strsrch, textOffset, &start, &end, status)) {
4636         strsrch->search->matchedIndex  = start;
4637         strsrch->search->matchedLength = end - start;
4638         return TRUE;
4639     } else {
4640         setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4641         return FALSE;
4642     }
4643 #endif
4644 }
4645 
4646 UBool usearch_handlePreviousExact(UStringSearch *strsrch, UErrorCode *status)
4647 {
4648     if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4649         setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4650         return FALSE;
4651     }
4652 
4653 #if BOYER_MOORE
4654     UCollationElements *coleiter        = strsrch->textIter;
4655     int32_t            *patternce       = strsrch->pattern.ces;
4656     int32_t             patterncelength = strsrch->pattern.cesLength;
4657     int32_t             textoffset      = ucol_getOffset(coleiter);
4658 
4659     // shifting it check for setting offset
4660     // if setOffset is called previously or there was no previous match, we
4661     // leave the offset as it is.
4662     if (strsrch->search->matchedIndex != USEARCH_DONE) {
4663         textoffset = strsrch->search->matchedIndex;
4664     }
4665 
4666     textoffset = reverseShift(strsrch, textoffset, UCOL_NULLORDER,
4667                               patterncelength);
4668 
4669     while (textoffset >= 0)
4670     {
4671         int32_t     patternceindex = 1;
4672         int32_t     targetce;
4673         UBool       found          = FALSE;
4674         int32_t     firstce        = UCOL_NULLORDER;
4675 
4676         // if status is a failure, ucol_setOffset does nothing
4677         setColEIterOffset(coleiter, textoffset);
4678 
4679         for (;;) {
4680             // finding the first pattern ce match, imagine composite
4681             // characters. for example: search for pattern \u0300 in text
4682             // \u00C0, we'll have to skip A first before we get to
4683             // \u0300 the grave accent
4684             targetce = ucol_next(coleiter, status);
4685             if (U_FAILURE(*status) || targetce == UCOL_NULLORDER) {
4686                 found = FALSE;
4687                 break;
4688             }
4689             targetce = getCE(strsrch, targetce);
4690             if (firstce == UCOL_NULLORDER || firstce == UCOL_IGNORABLE) {
4691                 firstce = targetce;
4692             }
4693             if (targetce == UCOL_IGNORABLE && strsrch->strength != UCOL_PRIMARY) {
4694                 continue;
4695             }
4696             // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, replace with code using 32-bit version of compareCE64s
4697             if (targetce == patternce[0]) {
4698                 found = TRUE;
4699                 break;
4700             }
4701             if (!hasExpansion(coleiter)) {
4702                 // checking for accents in composite character
4703                 found = FALSE;
4704                 break;
4705             }
4706         }
4707 
4708         //targetce = firstce;
4709 
4710         while (found && (patternceindex < patterncelength)) {
4711             firstce = targetce;
4712             targetce    = ucol_next(coleiter, status);
4713             if (U_FAILURE(*status) || targetce == UCOL_NULLORDER) {
4714                 found = FALSE;
4715                 break;
4716             }
4717             targetce    = getCE(strsrch, targetce);
4718             if (targetce == UCOL_IGNORABLE) {
4719                 continue;
4720             }
4721 
4722             // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, replace with code using 32-bit version of compareCE64s
4723             found = found && targetce == patternce[patternceindex];
4724             patternceindex ++;
4725         }
4726 
4727         targetce = firstce;
4728 
4729         if (!found) {
4730             if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4731                 break;
4732             }
4733 
4734             textoffset = reverseShift(strsrch, textoffset, targetce,
4735                                       patternceindex);
4736             patternceindex = 0;
4737             continue;
4738         }
4739 
4740         if (checkPreviousExactMatch(strsrch, &textoffset, status)) {
4741             setColEIterOffset(coleiter, textoffset);
4742             return TRUE;
4743         }
4744     }
4745     setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4746     return FALSE;
4747 #else
4748     int32_t textOffset;
4749 
4750     if (strsrch->search->isOverlap) {
4751         if (strsrch->search->matchedIndex != USEARCH_DONE) {
4752             textOffset = strsrch->search->matchedIndex + strsrch->search->matchedLength - 1;
4753         } else {
4754             // move the start position at the end of possible match
4755             initializePatternPCETable(strsrch, status);
4756             if (!initTextProcessedIter(strsrch, status)) {
4757                 setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4758                 return FALSE;
4759             }
4760             for (int32_t nPCEs = 0; nPCEs < strsrch->pattern.pcesLength - 1; nPCEs++) {
4761                 int64_t pce = strsrch->textProcessedIter->nextProcessed(NULL, NULL, status);
4762                 if (pce == UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER) {
4763                     // at the end of the text
4764                     break;
4765                 }
4766             }
4767             if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4768                 setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4769                 return FALSE;
4770             }
4771             textOffset = ucol_getOffset(strsrch->textIter);
4772         }
4773     } else {
4774         textOffset = ucol_getOffset(strsrch->textIter);
4775     }
4776 
4777     int32_t start = -1;
4778     int32_t end = -1;
4779 
4780     if (usearch_searchBackwards(strsrch, textOffset, &start, &end, status)) {
4781         strsrch->search->matchedIndex = start;
4782         strsrch->search->matchedLength = end - start;
4783         return TRUE;
4784     } else {
4785         setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4786         return FALSE;
4787     }
4788 #endif
4789 }
4790 
4791 UBool usearch_handlePreviousCanonical(UStringSearch *strsrch,
4792                                       UErrorCode    *status)
4793 {
4794     if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4795         setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4796         return FALSE;
4797     }
4798 
4799 #if BOYER_MOORE
4800     UCollationElements *coleiter        = strsrch->textIter;
4801     int32_t            *patternce       = strsrch->pattern.ces;
4802     int32_t             patterncelength = strsrch->pattern.cesLength;
4803     int32_t             textoffset      = ucol_getOffset(coleiter);
4804     UBool               hasPatternAccents =
4805        strsrch->pattern.hasSuffixAccents || strsrch->pattern.hasPrefixAccents;
4806 
4807     // shifting it check for setting offset
4808     // if setOffset is called previously or there was no previous match, we
4809     // leave the offset as it is.
4810     if (strsrch->search->matchedIndex != USEARCH_DONE) {
4811         textoffset = strsrch->search->matchedIndex;
4812     }
4813 
4814     textoffset = reverseShift(strsrch, textoffset, UCOL_NULLORDER,
4815                               patterncelength);
4816     strsrch->canonicalPrefixAccents[0] = 0;
4817     strsrch->canonicalSuffixAccents[0] = 0;
4818 
4819     while (textoffset >= 0)
4820     {
4821         int32_t     patternceindex = 1;
4822         int32_t     targetce;
4823         UBool       found          = FALSE;
4824         int32_t     firstce        = UCOL_NULLORDER;
4825 
4826         setColEIterOffset(coleiter, textoffset);
4827         for (;;) {
4828             // finding the first pattern ce match, imagine composite
4829             // characters. for example: search for pattern \u0300 in text
4830             // \u00C0, we'll have to skip A first before we get to
4831             // \u0300 the grave accent
4832             targetce = ucol_next(coleiter, status);
4833             if (U_FAILURE(*status) || targetce == UCOL_NULLORDER) {
4834                 found = FALSE;
4835                 break;
4836             }
4837             targetce = getCE(strsrch, targetce);
4838             if (firstce == UCOL_NULLORDER || firstce == UCOL_IGNORABLE) {
4839                 firstce = targetce;
4840             }
4841 
4842             // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, replace with code using 32-bit version of compareCE64s
4843             if (targetce == patternce[0]) {
4844                 // the first ce can be a contraction
4845                 found = TRUE;
4846                 break;
4847             }
4848             if (!hasExpansion(coleiter)) {
4849                 // checking for accents in composite character
4850                 found = FALSE;
4851                 break;
4852             }
4853         }
4854 
4855         targetce = firstce;
4856 
4857         while (found && patternceindex < patterncelength) {
4858             targetce    = ucol_next(coleiter, status);
4859             if (U_FAILURE(*status) || targetce == UCOL_NULLORDER) {
4860                 found = FALSE;
4861                 break;
4862             }
4863             targetce = getCE(strsrch, targetce);
4864             if (targetce == UCOL_IGNORABLE) {
4865                 continue;
4866             }
4867 
4868             // TODO: #if BOYER_MOORE, replace with code using 32-bit version of compareCE64s
4869             found = found && targetce == patternce[patternceindex];
4870             patternceindex ++;
4871         }
4872 
4873         // initializing the rearranged accent array
4874         if (hasPatternAccents && !found) {
4875             strsrch->canonicalPrefixAccents[0] = 0;
4876             strsrch->canonicalSuffixAccents[0] = 0;
4877             if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4878                 break;
4879             }
4880             found = doPreviousCanonicalMatch(strsrch, textoffset, status);
4881         }
4882 
4883         if (!found) {
4884             if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4885                 break;
4886             }
4887             textoffset = reverseShift(strsrch, textoffset, targetce,
4888                                       patternceindex);
4889             patternceindex = 0;
4890             continue;
4891         }
4892 
4893         if (checkPreviousCanonicalMatch(strsrch, &textoffset, status)) {
4894             setColEIterOffset(coleiter, textoffset);
4895             return TRUE;
4896         }
4897     }
4898     setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4899     return FALSE;
4900 #else
4901     int32_t textOffset;
4902 
4903     if (strsrch->search->isOverlap) {
4904         if (strsrch->search->matchedIndex != USEARCH_DONE) {
4905             textOffset = strsrch->search->matchedIndex + strsrch->search->matchedLength - 1;
4906         } else {
4907             // move the start position at the end of possible match
4908             initializePatternPCETable(strsrch, status);
4909             if (!initTextProcessedIter(strsrch, status)) {
4910                 setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4911                 return FALSE;
4912             }
4913             for (int32_t nPCEs = 0; nPCEs < strsrch->pattern.pcesLength - 1; nPCEs++) {
4914                 int64_t pce = strsrch->textProcessedIter->nextProcessed(NULL, NULL, status);
4915                 if (pce == UCOL_PROCESSED_NULLORDER) {
4916                     // at the end of the text
4917                     break;
4918                 }
4919             }
4920             if (U_FAILURE(*status)) {
4921                 setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4922                 return FALSE;
4923             }
4924             textOffset = ucol_getOffset(strsrch->textIter);
4925         }
4926     } else {
4927         textOffset = ucol_getOffset(strsrch->textIter);
4928     }
4929 
4930     int32_t start = -1;
4931     int32_t end = -1;
4932 
4933     if (usearch_searchBackwards(strsrch, textOffset, &start, &end, status)) {
4934         strsrch->search->matchedIndex = start;
4935         strsrch->search->matchedLength = end - start;
4936         return TRUE;
4937     } else {
4938         setMatchNotFound(strsrch);
4939         return FALSE;
4940     }
4941 #endif
4942 }
4943 
4944 #endif /* #if !UCONFIG_NO_COLLATION */
